EmailTemplate.subject: Microsoft and Manulife, Intro to Data Microservices, and a Call for Diversity
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
August 25th, 2016 <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dWJexxudXQE]]> Fireside Chat with Microsoft and Manulife James Watters sits down for a Fireside Chat with Corey Sanders, Partner Director for Azure at Microsoft; Jesse Bean, VP Head of Global Innovation at Manulife; and Sebastian Blandizzi, SVP and CIO at Manulife at SpringOne Platform. Watch Now <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dWJexxudXQE]]> <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-insights/features/introduction-to-data-microservices]]> Pivotal Insights: Episode 2 In this new episode of the Pivotal Insights Podcast, Jeff Kelly does a deep dive into data microservices with Vinicius Carvalho, a platform architect at Pivotal at the forefront of the data microservices movement. Listen In <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-insights/features/introduction-to-data-microservices]]> <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/features/a-call-for-diversity-at-the-next-pivotal-cloud-foundry-industry-day]]> A Call For Diversity at Pivotal Cloud Foundry Industry Day Inspired by Cornelia Davis’s SpringOne Platform keynote, Jeenal Shah makes the call for gender diversity at Seattle’s Industry Day on September 13th and 14th. Read More <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/features/a-call-for-diversity-at-the-next-pivotal-cloud-foundry-industry-day]]> <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/immutable-infrastructure-windows-and-bosh]]> BOSH Expands to Windows BOSH has been integral in helping Linux sysadmins achieve infrastructure immutability and with this new release, Bosh expands to Windows. Jared Ruckle discusses the benefits BOSH has for Windows administrators and its importance in his Pivotal blog post.
